Package edu.macalester.graphics

Class Rectangle

java.lang.Object
edu.macalester.graphics.GraphicsObject
edu.macalester.graphics.Rectangle
All Implemented Interfaces:
Fillable, Strokable
public class Rectangle
extends GraphicsObject
implements Strokable, Fillable
A rectangle that can be drawn on the screen.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Rectangle​(double x, double y, double width, double height)
    Creates a rectangle whose upper left is at (x,y) with the specified width and height.
    Rectangle​(Point upperLeft, Point size)
    Creates a rectangle with the given upper left corner and size.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    protected void draw​(java.awt.Graphics2D gc)
    For internal use.
    boolean equals​(java.lang.Object other)
    Tests whether the given object is a Rectangle with the same position and size.
    java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D getBounds()
    Returns an axis-aligned bounding rectangle for this graphical object.
    java.awt.Paint getFillColor()
    Returns the color to fillColor that will be used to fill this shape if it is filled.
    double getHeight()
    Returns the height of the rectangle.
    Point getPosition()
    Returns the position of the rectangle's upper left corner.
    java.awt.Paint getStrokeColor()
    Returns the color to strokeColor that will be used to stroke this shape if it is stroked.
    double getStrokeWidth()
    Returns the thickness of the stroke in pixels.
    double getWidth()
    Returns the width of the rectangle.
    double getX()
    Returns the X position of the rectangle's left edge.
    double getY()
    Returns the Y position of the rectangle's top edge.
    int hashCode()  
    boolean isFilled()
    Returns true if the interior of this shape will be filled with the fill color.
    boolean isStroked()
    Returns true if the interior of this shape will be stroked with the stroke color.
    void setFillColor​(java.awt.Paint fillColor)
    Sets the fill color to the given color.
    void setFilled​(boolean filled)
    Causes the shape to be filled with the fill color when it is drawn.
    void setPosition​(double x, double y)
    Moves this rectangle's upper left corner to (x, y), preserving its size.
    void setSize​(double width, double height)
    Changes the width and height of the rectangle, preserving its upper left corner's position.
    void setSize​(Point size)
    Changes the width and height of the rectangle, preserving its upper left corner's position.
    void setStrokeColor​(java.awt.Paint strokeColor)
    Sets the stroke color to the given color.
    void setStroked​(boolean stroked)
    Causes the shape to be stroked with the stroke color when it is drawn.
    void setStrokeWidth​(double width)
    Sets how thick the stroke is.
    boolean testHit​(double x, double y)
    Tests whether the given point is on the boundary or interior of this graphic object's shape.

    Returns a string representation of the rectangle

  • Constructor Details

    • Rectangle

      public Rectangle​(double x, double y, double width, double height)
      Creates a rectangle whose upper left is at (x,y) with the specified width and height. The rectangle has a 1 pixel black stroke outline by default.

    • Rectangle

      public Rectangle​(Point upperLeft, Point size)
      Creates a rectangle with the given upper left corner and size. The rectangle has a 1 pixel black stroke outline by default.

  • Method Details

    • draw

      protected void draw​(java.awt.Graphics2D gc)
      Description copied from class: GraphicsObject
      For internal use. Draws this graphics object on the screen.
      Specified by:
      draw in class GraphicsObject

    • getFillColor

      public java.awt.Paint getFillColor()
      Description copied from interface: Fillable
      Returns the color to fillColor that will be used to fill this shape if it is filled. Note that there will still be no fill if isFilled() is false.
      Specified by:
      getFillColor in interface Fillable

    • setFillColor

      public void setFillColor​(java.awt.Paint fillColor)
      Description copied from interface: Fillable
      Sets the fill color to the given color. Automatically calls setFilled(true).
      Specified by:
      setFillColor in interface Fillable

    • getStrokeColor

      public java.awt.Paint getStrokeColor()
      Description copied from interface: Strokable
      Returns the color to strokeColor that will be used to stroke this shape if it is stroked. Note that there will still be no stroke if isStroked() is false or the stroke width is zero.
      Specified by:
      getStrokeColor in interface Strokable

    • setStrokeColor

    • testHit

      public boolean testHit​(double x, double y)
      Description copied from class: GraphicsObject
      Tests whether the given point is on the boundary or interior of this graphic object's shape. The point is in this object's local coordinates, not canvas coordinates.

      Does not account for appearance, including stroke width and transparency.

      Specified by:
      testHit in class GraphicsObject

    • getBounds

      public java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D getBounds()

      Returns an axis-aligned bounding rectangle for this graphical object.
      Specified by:
      getBounds in class GraphicsObject

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object other)
      Tests whether the given object is a Rectangle with the same position and size. Ignores appearance, i.e. color and stroke width.
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
